subject: Simsonn Pro Plus P2 – Device not recognized in Config or F1 25
description_text:
Hello Simsonn Team,


I own a Simsonn Pro Plus P2 (two-pedal version, throttle + brake) currently
running firmware v1.8.0.


After the last firmware update, the device stopped being properly
recognized by your configuration tools and some racing titles.


Here’s what happens:


   -

   In Windows Game Controllers (joy.cpl), both X (throttle) and Y (brake)
   axes move correctly.

   -

   In SimPedals Config V4 and V3.5, the pedal shows as “Device
   Disconnected.”

   -

   In SimHub (Control Mapper) and vJoy, the device appears as connected but
   does not output any input movement.

   -

   In F1 25, the game detects the “Simsonn Plus” controller but does not
   allow mapping the throttle or brake axes.



It seems the firmware may be stuck in a partial HID communication mode,
which prevents third-party software and your Config tools from reading axis
data.


Could you please send me the correct .hex firmware file for the Simsonn Pro
Plus P2 and the detailed instructions to perform a full firmware reinstall
/ reset?


Device: Simsonn Pro Plus P2

Current Firmware: 1.8.0

Issue: Not recognized by SimPedals Config or F1 25 / SimHub not reading
inputs


Thank you very much for your help and support.


Best regards,

Luís Otávio Marçal

(Blumenau – Brazil)

conversations.body_text: Hi Luis Otávio Marçal,     You can refer to this post — it confirms that the feature is supported.     https://www.reddit.com/r/simracing/comments/1nj93bq/simsonn_plus_x_pedals_setup_guide_in_f1_25/

Hello Simsonn Team,


Thank you very much for your quick reply and for sending me the Reddit post
about configuring the pedals in F1 25.


I have followed that guide completely, but unfortunately the issue I’m
experiencing is different.

The problem is that the pedals do not send any input movement to the game
or to any third-party software.


Here’s a detailed summary:


   -

   The device appears correctly in Windows Game Controllers (joy.cpl) and
   both X (throttle) and Y (brake) axes move there.

   -

   However, in SimPedals Config (both V4 and V3.5), the device shows as
   “Device Disconnected.”

   -

   In SimHub (Control Mapper) and vJoy, the Simsonn Plus P2 is detected but
   the pedal movement does not register.

   -

   In F1 25, the game lists the “Simsonn Plus” device, but the throttle and
   brake cannot be assigned at all.



The hardware itself works perfectly in iRacing, so the issue seems related
to firmware communication (HID mode) rather than the physical device.


Could you please send me the correct .hex firmware file and the
instructions for a full firmware reinstall/reset for the Simsonn Pro Plus
P2?

I believe that performing a clean firmware flash in HID-only mode might
solve this behavior.


Thank you again for your help and support.


Best regards,

Luís Otávio Marçal

(Blumenau – Brazil)

Hi Luis Otávio Marçal,    You can use Simsonn Manager 2.1.0 to restore the firmware.  Go to Settings → Update → Manual Firmware Update → pedals → firmware → pedals-plus.sfu.  After the update, the pedals should work normally and allow you to recalibrate them.
